content:
I've edited the statement just now:

* Reformatted commands and parameters.

* Revised the upper limit of [[N]] from 2000 to 100.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle (especially for the nostalgic I guess...).

Nice puzzle, thanks!

Something looks weird with the tests:
There is no "Test 4", there are 2 "Validator 6", there are 2 "Test 7"...:

Test 1 / Validator 1
Test 2 / Validator 2
Test 3 / Validator 3
Test 5 / Validator 5
Test 6 / Validator 6
Test 7 / Validator 6
Test 7 / Validator 7
Test 8 / Validator 8

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun to do.  I love interpreters.  I was able to complete it with not a lot of code.  A good case for using a dictionary of lambda delegates.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle, the difficulty is adequate & enough tests/validators diversity.

This is an interesting puzzle, I think it is missing a test/validator where there's an empty line to check that it's not removed, something like that:
1
RT 90;FD 2;RT 180;FD 1;LT 90;FD 2;PU;FD 1;SETPC *;PD;FD 1;LT 90;FD 1;RT 180;FD 3

###
  #

  *
***

The puzzle looks interesting.

Title
* Please change it to "ASCII Art with Logo Language" for proper capitalisation, as well as consistency as "Logo" is used instead of "LOGO" in other sections.

Goal section
* Suggest to change "subset of Logo" to "subset of Logo instructions".

* Suggest to change {{integer}} to {{times}}.

* Please change "multiples positives" to "positive multiples" (2 times).

* Please change ';' and '# #' to {{;}} and {{# #}}. Please also remove the quotation marks.

* Do you mean <<North>> instead of <<Nord>>?

* Please change "leave a trace" and "leave a symbol" to "leaves a trace" and "leaves a symbol".

* Suggest to format all the instructions in <<bold>> too, e.g. <<PU>>.

* CS doesn't seem to have any impact on the cases? I mean:
• If CS is the first command, the screen is empty at that point anyway (even without CS).
• If CS is not the first command, does that mean I just ignore all the commands up to CS?

* Also, I have no idea what location "screen center" refers to, and that doesn't seem to have any impact either.

Input section
* Please change "the next lines" to "the number of lines".

* Please change "istructions" to "instructions".

Output section
* Please change "ART" to "art".

* I think you mean "no extra trailing spaces". All leading spaces should be removed only to the extent that the overall image is not affected.

Cases
* You'll further revise the cases as mentioned in your comment.

Thanks.
I'll fix test cases and validators if there is interest in this proposal. Thanks

Hi, I think I fixed it, improved the CS command and added some specifics on spaces. I also fixed and integrated the tests (I should add a few more). 
Thank you for your support.
Thanks! I added your test and validator. I plan to add more test soon.
Thanks! I'm thinking to extend the concept to part 2 with REPEAT command (for loops) and lines at 45 degree. What do you think?
Thanks! Get ready for part 2 and 3 :-)
Fixed! Thanks

Try part 2!
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4522582665e3fc50be46171452399f63d6049

Part 2: check it out and let me know! 
Thanks
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4522582665e3fc50be46171452399f63d6049
I think that would be a nice extension to this puzzle.

Part 2 is out!
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4522582665e3fc50be46171452399f63d6049

Thank you :)

Cover picture
* What is that? How is it related to this puzzle? :open_mouth: (I'm not suggesting you should change it. I'm just confused.)

Goal section
* Please change "orizontal" to "horizontal".

* Please change "leave a trace" and "leave a symbol" to "leaves a trace" and "leaves a symbol".

* Please change "not necessay" to "unnecessary".

Output section
* Suggest to move "All leading spaces should be removed only to the extent that the overall image is not affected." to Goal section, in front of "All unnecessary spaces...".

Cases
* As you said you should add a few more tests, I would like to see, if possible, the final pair of cases featuring all instructions and a variety of mixing letter cases (e.g. setPC, pD, Cs).

Thanks again.

Cover picture
* What is that? 
I found it in the wikibook manual of Librelogo in italian
https://it.wikibooks.org/wiki/Piccolo_manuale_di_LibreLogo/Testo_completo. I think it is a man that drive a Turtle in the main square of Florence. I used the photo because is CC BY-SA 4.0. I'll search something different.
OK :)

In case you still want to find another cover picture for this puzzle and/or Part 2, you may try to generate one yourself using one of the implementations listed on wiki:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logo_(programming_language

I've just tried UCBLogo on Mac OS but it can't even start. However, QLogo runs fine.
